Can you explain why `getgenerate` returns a string indicating whether the server is set to mine or mint coins?

`getgenerate` actually returns a JSON object with three properties: `staking`, `generate`, and `numthreads`. The `staking` and `generate` properties are booleans indicating whether staking and mining are on or off, respectively. The `numthreads` property is a numeric value representing the processor limit for mining. It does not return a string.

getgenerate

Return if the server is set to mine and/or mint coins or not. The default is false.
It is set with the command line argument -gen and -mint (or conf file settings gen and mint)
It can also be set with the setgenerate call.

Result
{
 "staking": true|false   (boolean) If staking is on or off (see setgenerate)
 "generate": true|false   (boolean) If mining is on or off (see setgenerate)
 "numthreads": n      (numeric) The processor limit for mining. (see setgenerate)
}

Examples:
> verus getgenerate 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getgenerate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How do I use the `getgenerate` command to set the server to mine coins?

`getgenerate` is a command to retrieve information about whether the server is set to mine and/or mint coins, it does not set the server to mine coins. To set the server to mine coins, you would use the `setgenerate` command or the command line arguments `-gen` and `-mint` (or the corresponding conf file settings).

getgenerate

Return if the server is set to mine and/or mint coins or not. The default is false.
It is set with the command line argument -gen and -mint (or conf file settings gen and mint)
It can also be set with the setgenerate call.

Result
{
 "staking": true|false   (boolean) If staking is on or off (see setgenerate)
 "generate": true|false   (boolean) If mining is on or off (see setgenerate)
 "numthreads": n      (numeric) The processor limit for mining. (see setgenerate)
}

Examples:
> verus getgenerate 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getgenerate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the default value for `numthreads` in the `getgenerate` result?
The default value for `numthreads` is not specified. It is a numeric value representing the processor limit for mining, but its default value is not provided.

getgenerate

Return if the server is set to mine and/or mint coins or not. The default is false.
It is set with the command line argument -gen and -mint (or conf file settings gen and mint)
It can also be set with the setgenerate call.
